name: AmazonEC2
description: Amazon Elastic Cloud Compute - compute capacity in the cloud

params.name: accessKeyId
params.description: AWS Access Key ID to use for authentication

params.name: secretAccessKey
params.description: AWS Secret Access Key to use for authentication

settings.name: region
settings.description: AWS Region to use by default

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: IMAGE_ID
params.description: An AMI is a template that contains the software configuration (operating system, application server, and applications) required to launch an instance.

params.name: INSTANCE_TYPE
params.description: Instance type determines quantity and type of computing, memory, networking, and disk resources made available to the instance.

params.name: KEY_NAME
params.description: Key pair name determines which private .pem or .ppk key may be used to access the new instance.

params.name: SECURITY_GROUP_IDS
params.description: Security Groups act as firewall rules, determining which sorts of network traffic are allowed in and out of the instance. Specify one per line.

params.name: USER_DATA
params.description: User data is a command or script that is automatically run after the instance is launched.

params.name: MIN_COUNT
params.description: Minimum number of instances to launch, if launching more than one

params.name: MAX_COUNT
params.description: Maximum number of instances to launch, if launching more than one

params.name: subnetId
params.description: The subnet on which the new instance will be networked

params.name: NAME_TAG
params.description: Optionally specify the "Name" tag of the new instance.

params.name: rootVolumeSize
params.description: The size of the root volume in GiB

params.name: TAGS_SPECIFICATION
params.description: Optional tags to apply to the resources during launch, as Key=Value pairs, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to start, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to stop, one per line

params.name: WAIT_FOR_STOP
params.description: Wait for the specified instances to stop completely before continuing with pipeline

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to reboot, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: The IDs of the instances to TERMINATE, one per line

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: INSTANCE_IDS
params.description: Optional IDs of specific instances to describe, one per line. If empty all instances may be described.

params.name: filters
params.description: Optional array of filters to select specific instances

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: GET_ALL_RECURSIVELY
params.description: If enabled, retrieves all results instead of only the first 1000 instances.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: instanceIds
params.description: The IDs of the instances to modify, one per line

params.description: Instance type determines quantity and type of computing, memory, networking, and disk resources made available to the instance.

params.description: A name for the new key pair.

params.name: ADDRESS
params.description: The Elastic IP address to recover or an IPv4 address from an address pool.

params.name: PUBLICIPV4POOL
params.description: The ID of an address pool that you own. Use this parameter to let Amazon EC2 select an address from the address pool. To specify a specific address from the address pool, use the Address parameter instead.

params.name: DRYRUN
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: ALLOCATION_ID
params.description: The elastic IP allocation to be associated

params.name: INSTANCE_ID
params.description: ID of an instance if associating to an EC2 instance

params.name: NETWORK_INTERFACE_ID
params.description: ID of an interface if associating to an elastic network interface

params.name: PRIVATE_IP_ADDRESS
params.description: A private IP address if associating with an IP address

params.description: The elastic IP allocation to be released

params.name: region

params.name: cidrBlock
params.description: The IPv4 network range for the VPC, in CIDR notation. For example, 10.0.0.0/16.

params.name: amazonProvidedIpv6CidrBlock
params.description: Requests an Amazon-provided IPv6 CIDR block with a /56 prefix length for the VPC. You cannot specify the range of IP addresses, or the size of the CIDR block.

params.name: instanceTenancy
params.description: The tenancy options for instances launched into the VPC. value can be "default" or ."dedicated".

params.name: createInternetGateway
params.description: If true, create an Internet gateway and attach it this VPC. Default value is false.

params.name: tags
params.description: Optional tags to apply to AWS resources, as Key or Key=Value pairs, one per line

params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request, and provides an error response.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC.

params.name: routeTableId
params.description: If specified, associate the subnet with the specified Route Table.Doesn't work together with the parameter 'Create Private Route Table'.

params.name: availabilityZone
params.description:
The Availability Zone or Local Zone for the subnet.Default(if not provided):AWS selects one for you. If you create more than one subnet in your VPC, AWS does not necessarily select a different zone for each subnet.
To create a subnet in a Local Zone, set this value to the Local Zone ID, for example us-west-1c. For information about the Regions that support Local Zones, see Available Regions in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. To create a subnet in an Outpost, set this value to the Availability Zone for the Outpost and specify the Outpost ARN.

params.name: cidrBlock
params.description: The IPv4 network range for the VPC, in CIDR notation. For example, 10.0.0.0/16.

params.name: ipv6CidrBlock
params.description: The IPv6 network range for the subnet, in CIDR notation. The subnet size must use a /64 prefix length.

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost. If you specify an Outpost ARN, you must also specify the Availability Zone of the Outpost subnet.

params.name: allocationId
params.description: If specified, create a NAT Gateway within the subnet created, with the Elastic IP address of the specified Allocation.

params.name: createPrivateRouteTable
params.description:
If specified, it creates a new route table and connects it to the subnet.
In case a NAT Gateway was also created from this function, also create a default route from the route table to the NAT Gateway. This proccess needs to wait for the NAT Gateway to be available whichmight take a couple of minutes!

params.name: mapPublicIpOnLaunch
params.description: If specified modify the attribute 'Map Public IP On Launch' on the subnet to true, using this command: [documentaion](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSJavaScriptSDK/latest/AWS/EC2.Ifhtml#modifySubnetAttribute-property). The subnet will map a public ip address to any instance launched from it.

params.description: Optional tags to apply to AWS resources, as Key or Key=Value pairs, one per line

params.name: natGatewayId

params.name: instanceId

params.name: destinationCidrBlock

params.name: routeTableId
params.description:
The ID of the route table to associate.

5. Subnet ID (String)Optional- If specified, associate the route table with the specified subnet.

params.name: subnetId
params.description: If specified, associate the route table with the specified subnet.

params.name: gatewayId
params.description: If specified, associate the route table with the specified internet gateway.

params.name: DryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: availabilityZone
params.description: The Availability Zone in which to create the volume.

params.name: volumeType
params.description: The volume type.

params.name: size
params.description: The size of the volume, in GBs. You must specify either a snapshot ID or a volume size. If you specify a snapshot, the default is the snapshot size. You can specify a volume size that is equal to or larger than the snapshot size.

params.name: iops
params.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). Only for volume types io1, io2 and gp3.

params.name: snapshotId
params.description: If specified create the volume from the snapshot specified.

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: If specified create the volume on the outpost specified.

params.name: throughput
params.description: This parameter is valid only for gp3 volumes. The throughput to provision for the volume, with a maximum of 1,000 MiB/s.

params.name: encrypted
params.description: Indicates Whether to encrypt the volume or not. Encryption type depends on the volume origin (new or from a snapshot), starting encryption state, ownership, and whether encryption by default is enabled.

params.name: kmsKeyId
params.description: The identifier of the Key Management Service (KMS) KMS Key to use for Amazon EBS encryption. If this parameter is not specified, your KMS Key for Amazon EBS is used. If KmsKeyId is specified, the encrypted state must be true. You can specify the KMS Key using any of the following: Key ID | Key alias | Key ARN | Alias ARN

params.name: multiAttachEnabled
params.description: Indicates whether to enable Amazon EBS Multi-Attach. If you enable Multi-Attach, you can attach the volume to up to 16 Instances built on the Nitro System in the same Availability Zone. This parameter is supported with io1 and io2 volumes only.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

params.name: waitForEnd
params.description: Wait until the end of the operation. The operation ends when the volume is ready.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: volumeId
params.description: The ID of the volume to create the snapshot of.

params.name: description
params.description: A description for the snapshot.

params.name: outpostArn
params.description: If specified, create the snapshot on the outpost specified. Not related to the outpost the volume is stored on.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation. Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

params.name: waitForEnd
params.description: Wait until the end of the operation. The operation ends when the snapshot is completed.

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new security group to create.

params.name: description
params.description: A description for the new security group
params.placeholder: Allows web traffic on TCP ports 80, 443, and 8080-8090

params.name: vpcId
params.description: The ID of the VPC. Required for EC2-VPC Security Group.

params.name: tags
params.description: Optional tags to apply to AWS resources, as Key or Key=Value pairs, one per line

params.name: disallowOutboundTraffic
params.description: Disallow any outgoing traffic. Default is false.

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: groupId
params.description: The ID of the security group to add the rules to.

params.name: ruleType
params.description:
The type of rules to create.
Possible Values are: Ingress-Authorize/Egress-Authorize/Ingress-Revoke/Egress-Revoke. Default Value is Ingress-Authorize.

params.name: cidrIps
params.description: The IP v6 ranges in CIDR notation to apply to the rule(To authorize\revoke). To enter multiple values separate each with a new line.

params.name: cidrIps6
params.description: The IP v6 ranges in CIDR notation to apply to the rule(To authorizeevoke). To enter multiple values separate each with a new line.

params.name: portRanges
params.description: Ranges of allowed ports for this rule. You can specify a range of ports or just one port. Please specify one range per line.

params.name: ipProtocol
params.description: The protocol to which this rule applies

params.name: icmpType
params.description: If specified protocol is ICMP, optionally select a specific type to target with this rule.

params.name: description
params.description: Optional description for the rule

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Checks to see if credentials have sufficient privileges for the action without having any effect on AWS resources

params.name: region
params.description: AWS region in which the action is to be executed

params.name: resourceId
params.description: AWS ID of the EC2 resource to add the tags to.

params.name: tags
params.description: Tags to apply to AWS resources, as Key or Key=Value pairs, one per line
